publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-203 Michael Matheson: Tobacco Advertising Ban—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to maintain its commitment to banning tobacco advertising in Scotland by the end of 1999; notes that Scotland has one of the highest incidences of lung cancer in western Europe, with smoking accounting for around 90% of all lung cancer and notes that any delay in banning tobacco advertising will seriously undermine the battle to reduce the misery of lung cancer in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram*, Shona Robison*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Alex Neil*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-203 Tobacco Advertising Ban (lodged on 12 October 1999) Fiona McLeod*, Brian Adam*

S1M-203 Michael Matheson: Tobacco Advertising Ban—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to maintain its commitment to banning tobacco advertising in Scotland by the end of 1999; notes that Scotland has one of the highest incidences of lung cancer in western Europe, with smoking accounting for around 90% of all lung cancer and notes that any delay in banning tobacco advertising will seriously undermine the battle to reduce the misery of lung cancer in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Shona Robison, Nicola Sturgeon, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Brian Adam
S1M-203 Tobacco Advertising Ban (lodged on 12 October 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-203 Tobacco Advertising Ban (lodged on 12 October 1999) Irene McGugan*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-203 Michael Matheson: Tobacco Advertising Ban—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to maintain its commitment to banning tobacco advertising in Scotland by the end of 1999; notes that Scotland has one of the highest incidences of lung cancer in western Europe, with smoking accounting for around 90% of all lung cancer and notes that any delay in banning tobacco advertising will seriously undermine the battle to reduce the misery of lung cancer in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Shona Robison, Nicola Sturgeon, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Brian Adam, Ms Margo MacDonald, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-203 Tobacco Advertising Ban (lodged on 12 October 1999) Richard Lochhead*

S1M-203 Michael Matheson: Tobacco Advertising Ban—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to maintain its commitment to banning tobacco advertising in Scotland by the end of 1999; notes that Scotland has one of the highest incidences of lung cancer in western Europe, with smoking accounting for around 90% of all lung cancer and notes that any delay in banning tobacco advertising will seriously undermine the battle to reduce the misery of lung cancer in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Shona Robison, Nicola Sturgeon, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Brian Adam, Ms Margo MacDonald, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nora Radcliffe, Richard Lochhead
S1M-203 Tobacco Advertising Ban (lodged on 12 October 1999) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-203 Michael Matheson: Tobacco Advertising Ban-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to maintain its commitment to banning tobacco advertising in Scotland by the end of 1999; notes that Scotland has one of the highest incidences of lung cancer in western Europe, with smoking accounting for around 90% of all lung cancer and notes that any delay in banning tobacco advertising will seriously undermine the battle to reduce the misery of lung cancer in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Shona Robison, Nicola Sturgeon, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Brian Adam, Ms Margo MacDonald, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nora Radcliffe, Richard Lochhead, Tommy Sheridan

S1M-203 Michael Matheson: Tobacco Advertising Ban—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to maintain its commitment to banning tobacco advertising in Scotland by the end of 1999; notes that Scotland has one of the highest incidences of lung cancer in western Europe, with smoking accounting for around 90% of all lung cancer and notes that any delay in banning tobacco advertising will seriously undermine the battle to reduce the misery of lung cancer in Scotland. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Shona Robison, Nicola Sturgeon, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Brian Adam, Ms Margo MacDonald, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nora Radcliffe, Richard Lochhead, Tommy Sheridan, Fergus Ewing
